snippet: Even if the United States wins a trade case against China, by the time policies are changed, more Western and Japanese factories will have moved there.
abstract: Trade case filed by United States, the European Union and Japan against China over its export restrictions on strategic rare earth metals may be too late for Western and Japanese manufacturers; international trade officials, industry leaders and specialists in China and the West warn that Beijing will have a strong hand of cards as it seeks to defend its export policies.
lead_paragraph: Even if the United States wins a trade case against China, by the time policies are changed, more Western and Japanese factories will have moved there.

headline.seo: Rare Earth Trade Case Against China May Be Too Late
headline.main: Specialists in Rare Earths Say a Trade Case Against China May Be Too Late
headline.print_headline: Specialists in Rare Earths Say a Trade Case Against China May Be Too Late
